products.name: MC722 – WEB SPRAY NON-FLAM/NON-METHYLENE CHLORIDE CONTACT ADHESIVE
products.description: ForzaBOND™ MC722 is a non-flammable contact adhesive.

applications: Ensure all surfaces are clean and free of grease, dirt, dust, etc.
Apply adhesive to both surfaces to be mated, at 80% to 100% coverage
Allow 2-4 minutes (or until dry to the touch) for the adhesive to become tacky before bonding. Parts should be mated with as much pressure as practical
Normal coverage with a web spray pattern is approximately 80%; porous surfaces may require a second coat
Initial bond is strong enough for immediate cutting or trimming, with ultimate strength achieved in approximately 24 hours

products.name: M-OA755 – HIGH-STRENGTH SINGLE-PART HYBRID POLYMER ADHESIVE/SEALANT
products.description: ForzaBOND™ M-OA755 is a structural, hybrid polymer, single-part moisture cure adhesive.
benefits: Retains strong bond through impact, peel, flex, and changing temperatures
Does not form bubbles, shrink or crack upon curing
Can be painted in most applications

applications: Generally applied by extrusion and trowel
Surfaces should be clean and free of dust, oil, and grease
Apply between 34° and 150°F, in damp or dry conditions. The majority of its strength is developed in the first 24 hours
Minimum cure time is overnight, but several days may be required for maximum performance. Cure time may be accelerated at higher temperatures (do not exceed 150°F for accelerated cure)
Most parts do not require fixturing, although heavy parts may require temporary clamping to ensure desired positioning

products.name: M-R420 – EPOXY QUICK-SET TWO-PART ADHESIVE
products.description: ForzaBOND™ M-R420 is a two-part, reactive adhesive with a very fast cure and wide range of uses.
benefits: 3 minute work life, 8 minute handling strength
Resistant to water, salt, vehicle fuels and fluids, and many other substances

applications: A two-part 1:1 mix ratio
Requires ensuring flow from both sides of the cartridge, attaching a static mixer, and gunning out material
Apply mixed adhesive to one surface to be bonded, then mate the second surface
Surfaces should be clean and dry, free of dust and debris; in most cases, no abrasion or solvent wipe is necessary

products.name: M-R445 – TWO-PART EPOXY ADHESIVE
products.description: ForzaBOND™ M-R445 is a two-part modified epoxy adhesive with moderate cure and wide range of  applications.
benefits: Retains flexible bond line, outperforms most "brittle" two part adhesives

applications: For cartridges: ensure flow from both sides of cartridge is possible, attach static mixer and gun out material
Apply mixed adhesive to one surface to be bonded then mate second surface
Surfaces should be clean and dry and in most cases no abrasion or solvent wipe is necessary
The B side will stiffen at temperatures below 32°F/0°C. The material may have to be heated to return to usable viscosity
For bulk: Ensure flow from both drums and in both hoses. Attach static mixer and gun out adhesive as desired
Apply to one surface to be bonded, then mate the second surface
Surfaces should be clean and dry
Use abrasive or solvent wipe only if necessary
Clean up with mineral spirits/wet rag

products.name: M-OSA783 – ADHESIVE PRIMER & PROMOTER

applications: Wet rag with ForzaBOND M-OSA783, wipe on surface in one direction turning rag approximately every three feet
Let air dry for at least 5 min. Surface may show slight milky film
Bond surfaces no more than 3 hours after apply surface activator

benefits: 80% of final strength achieved upon bonding

applications: Be sure all surfaces are clean and free of grease, dirt, dust, etc.
Apply to both surfaces to be bonded

benefits: 80% of final strength achieved immediately, full strength achieved in approximately 24 hours

applications: Be sure all surfaces are clean and free of grease, dirt, dust, etc.
Apply to both surfaces to be bonded by brushing, rolling or spraying
Adhesive should be applied to each surface, allowed to dry (until non-transferable to gloved finger), then bonded under pressure

products.name: MC739 – MIST SPRAY ADHESIVE FOR FIBERGLASS INFUSION MOLDING
products.description: ForzaBOND™ MC739 is a mist spray adhesive designed for fiberglass infusion molding.
benefits: Designed to not interfere with the curing process of vinyl ester, polyester, and styrene resins
Tackifier Resin, engineered to dissolve and become part of the polymer matrix
Does not act as a contaminant to most resins
Helps improve overall strength of composite structures by eliminating wet out (uncured resin pockets)
Ultra-efficient portable low maintenance spray system (requires no external air sources)

applications: Apply a thin layer of MC739 onto the intended bonding surfaces
Let adhesive flash and become tacky to touch
Apply fabric materials; fabric should hold in place
Recommended operating temperatures range between 60° F and 100° F. Store the canister system in a warm environment

In the event of cold weather or if the canister becomes cold and gives an inconsistent spray pattern, it's suggested that the canister be warmed. Best practice is submersing the canister in warm water or using an electric heating blanket that can be purchased from Forza
Do not store at temperatures exceeding 120° F

products.name: C130 – HIGH HEAT NEOPRENE ADHESIVE
products.description: ForzaBOND™ C-130 is a flammable, high-performance, neoprene industrial contact adhesive.
benefits: 80% of final strength achieved upon bonding

applications: Be sure all surfaces are clean and free of grease, dirt, dust, etc. Apply to both surfaces to be bonded.
Adhesive should be applied to each surface, allowed to dry (until non transferable to finger), then bonded under pressure.
When brushing, multiple coats may be required on porous surfaces.
When spraying, use of DeVilbiss JGA with FX tip and needle or Binks 2001 or 95 gun and 63B tip 2nd needle or similar equipment is satisfactory.
Apply pressure with a hand laminate roller or nip roller. If adhesive is left to dry for over 30 minutes, parts should be re-coated.

Normal coverage required with web spray pattern is approximately 80%. Initial bond is strong enough to allow cutting or trimming immediately although ultimate strength is achieved in approximately 24 hours.
Store away from heat, flames or other sources of ignition. If spray tip clogs unscrew the spray tip from the gun and clean with a solvent such as lacquer thinner or acetone.
Do not use a pin on the spray tip orifice.

applications: ForzaBOND® T-R785 is a two-part 1:1 mix ratio that is available in dual cartridges or bulk
Using Cartridges: Ensure flow from both sides of the cartridge dispenser; attach a static mixer and gun out material
Application: After the adhesive is mixed, apply it to one surface to be bonded, then mate the second surface
Surface Preparation: Surfaces should be clean and dry, and in most cases, no abrasion or solvent wipe is necessary
Working Time: You have only 3-4 minutes to put parts together
Curing: Hold parts in position while curing (pressure clamping is not required)
Handling Strength: At room temperature, handling strength is achieved at 7-10 minutes
Full Cure: Full cure is achieved in 2-3 hours

products.applications:
ForzaBOND™ C-OS9 is designed for universal sealing applications in the construction industry, including:
- Crack filling on concrete
- Sealing around windows and door openings
- Sealing in gutter applications
- Roof penetrations
benefits: Retains strong bond through impact, peel, flex, and changing temperature
Does not form bubbles, shrink or crack
howToUse: Generally applied by extrusion, and trowel.
Surfaces should be clean and free of dust, oil, and grease.
Aluminum and other metals may be primed for best adhesion.
Apply between 34ºF and 150ºF, in damp and dry conditions.
Most of its strength develops in the first 24 hours.
Minimum cure time is overnight, but several days may be required for maximum performance, however cure time may be accelerated at higher temperatures.
Most parts do not require clamping, although heavy parts may require temporary clamping to ensure desired positioning.

applications: Crack filling on concrete
Sealing around windows and door openings
Sealing in gutter applications
Roof penetrations

applications: Be sure all surfaces are clean and free of grease, dirt, dust, etc
Hold applicator perpendicular to substrate, 6-10 inches away
Apply adhesive to both surfaces to be mated, at 80% to 100% coverage
Allow enough time (2-4 minutes or until dry to the touch) for the adhesive to become tacky before bonding
Parts should be mated with as much pressure as practical
Normal coverage required with web spray pattern is approximately 80%; however, porous surfaces may need a second coat
Initial bond is strong enough to allow cutting or trimming immediately, although ultimate strength is achieved in approximately 24 hours

products.name: OS2 – MULTI-PURPOSE HYBRID POLYMER SEALANT
products.description: ForzaSEAL™ OS2 is a non-hazardous, moisture-cure sealant.
benefits: Retains strong seal through impact, peel,  flex, and changing temperature
Does not form bubbles, shrink or crack

applications: Generally applied by extrusion or trowel.
Surfaces should be clean and free of dust,  oil and grease.
Aluminum and other metals may be primed  for best adhesion.
Apply between 34ºF and 150ºF, in damp and  dry conditions.
The majority of its strength is developed in  the first 24 hours.
Minimum cure time is overnight, but several  days may be required for maximum  performance, however cure time may be  accelerated at higher temperatures (do not  exceed 150ºF for accelerated cure).
Most parts do not require clamping,  although heavy parts may require  temporary clamping to ensure desired  positioning.
Easy clean up with wet rag or alcohol.
